features.situation: on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun
to initiative rolls for your side (+2 if you are the leader)

children.name: Fit

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, or resist poison

children.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

children.name: Very Fit

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, resist poison

children.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate; lose FP at half the normal rate (in both cases, not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

features.situation: to rolls for any lengthy mental task you concentrate on to the exclusion of other activities, if the GM feels such focus would be beneficial
to all rolls to notice interruptions while obsessed with a task

children.name: Magnetic Lift (Flight)
children.notes: Air Move is Basic Speed x 2 (drop all fractions)

children.name: Enhanced Move (Air)
children.notes: Multiply normal Air Move by 1 + level

children.name: Flight
children.notes: Air Move is Basic Speed x 2 (drop all fractions)

modifiers.name: Know Your Own Strength Variant Price

Only Damaged by @1. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@, @2. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@ or @3. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@

advantages.name: 4 - A total of -20 Points from the following Disadvantages:

modifiers.name: Mild
modifiers.notes: -2 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifiers.name: Severe
modifiers.notes: -4 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifiers.name: Agonizing
modifiers.notes: -6 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

children.name: Lame (Crippled Legs)

features.situation: to use any skill that requires the use of your legs, including all Melee Weapon and unarmed combat skills (but not ranged combat skills)

children.notes: You must reduce your Basic Move to half your Basic Speed (round down)

children.name: Lame (Missing Legs)

features.situation: to use any skill that requires the use of your legs, including all Melee Weapon and unarmed combat skills (but not ranged combat skills)

children.notes: Using crutches or a peg leg, you can stand up and walk slowly. You must reduce Basic Move to 2.

children.name: One Arm

features.situation: on tasks that are possible with one arm but that are usually executed with two

children.notes: You cannot use two-handed weapons, wield two weapons at once (or a weapon and a shield), or perform any task that requires two arms

children.name: One Hand

features.situation: on tasks that are possible with one arm but that are usually executed with two

children.notes: You cannot use two-handed weapons, wield two weapons at once (or a weapon and a shield), or perform any task that requires two arms

children.name: Overconfidence

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

children.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

children.name: Trickster
children.notes: Make a self-control roll each day. If you fail, you must try to trick a dangerous subject: a skilled warrior, a dangerous monster, a whole group of reasonably competent opponents, etc. If you resist, you get a cumulative -1 per day to your self-control roll until you finally fail a roll!

skills.name: 1 - Choose One of the Following Skills:
2 - Choose two of the following Skills:

notes.text: 500 points - The theme of your abilities is exerting force at a distance, whether by telekinesis, gravity, or magnetism. Telekinesis is normally a psionic power; gravity and magnetism are usually generic super powers. Like the blaster, you’re a ranged-attack specialist, but the effects of your abilities often look like grappling or knockback – and mostly use melee-attack skills.
